result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Decarlontae L Redd-Jackson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Decarlontae Lamar Jackson in court, in custody.  
Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Decarlontae Lamar Jackson.  
Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court on defense motion to modify baiL.
Bail bond hearing proceeded.   Arguments heard by defense and the State. Court DENIED defense bail motion for reasons placed on the record
Defense request a status date. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Decarlontae L Redd-Jackson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Decarlontae L Redd-Jackson.  Attorney William Ackell appeared in person for Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Status Conference. 
Defendant has a pending matter before the court, which has been adjourned. This case to follow.   
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Decarlontae L Redd-Jackson not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Court grants defense motion to withdraw bail/bond hearing.  Defendant has another pending felony case 22CF1880 in Branch 19.  Case will be reassigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Decarlontae L Redd-Jackson in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Decarlontae L Redd-Jackson in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Decarlontae L Redd-Jackson appeared by video means with Attorney.   
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Oak Creek PD Officer N. Raffini. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Decarlontae L Redd-Jackson in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Decarlontae L Redd-Jackson in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Decarlontae L Redd-Jackson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
